channel.title: Private Servers
channel.description:
I've been lurking in the shadows for some time now, took a fair amount of time off of the scene simply because of my full time work and personal schedule but none the less I keep looking around every now and then. I remember not the longest time ago there were constant changes to the RSPS scene in a way; different bases All-star Scape/Czar/Hyperion all that stuff in general.
Now it's gone? I mean as in the projects look the exact same - Delta is still thriving as a platform for a server to hold potentially hundreds of people from many different places in the work (can say the same for Project Insanity) but I understand from a learners prospective to learn from something simple/easy. But if this is the case why are people showing off the amount of players their PI/Delta servers can hold? As if there unique spawn pvp server is going to hit this amount anyway.
Maybe I'm confusing you by attacking two points at once; just sad to see the progression lost and people learn from bad examples.. I don't know just having a dig I suppose. Your thoughts?

item.title: Private Servers
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

I would say that private server’s have advanced far more than ever in the past 3 years. We know almost everything about the 317 client, just some of the work posted here isn’t impressive but there are people who are advancing fast.

Read full topic
